verbs.description: disbar (third-person singular simple present disbars, present participle disbarring, simple past and past participle disbarred)

entries.meaning: (law, transitive) To expel from the bar, or the legal profession; to deprive (an attorney, barrister, or counselor) of his or her status and privileges as such.

examples: The friends of Holmes have been criticising the action of the board in disbarring him on the ground that it was too severe  […]
